column1: [[Rhona Beare]] had a number of questions about the first two volumes of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' which Tolkien answered:
* Aragorn's boast that he was of NÃºmenor "unmingled" referred to his paternal line of ancestry.<ref>{{RK
* [[Treebeard]] was using ancient Elvish in an Entish fashion in his songs, not Entish sounds.  Tolkien listed the elements of his songs with translations.<ref>{{TT
* Treebeard's greeting to [[Celeborn]] and [[Galadriel]] meant "O beautiful ones, parents of beautiful children."<ref>{{RK
* Tolkien translated lines 2, 4, 6, 7, and 9 of the song of praise in "[[The Field of Cormallen]]".<ref>{{RK
